paragraphs.content: Psalm 73
paragraphs.contentHtml: Psalm 73

paragraphs.content: A Psalm of Asaph.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A Psalm of Asaph.

paragraphs.content: Truly God is good to Israel, even to such as are of a clean heart.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Truly God is good to Israel, even to such as are of a clean heart.

paragraphs.content: But as for me, my feet were almost gone; my steps had well nigh slipped.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But as for me, my feet were almost gone; my steps had well nigh slipped.

paragraphs.content: For I was envious at the foolish, when I saw the prosperity of the wicked.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For I was envious at the foolish, when I saw the prosperity of the wicked.

paragraphs.content: For there are no bands in their death: but their strength is firm.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For there are no bands in their death: but their strength is firm.

paragraphs.content: They are not in trouble as other men; neither are they plagued like other men.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They are not in trouble as other men; neither are they plagued like other men.

paragraphs.content: Therefore pride compasseth them about as a chain; violence covereth them as a garment.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Therefore pride compasseth them about as a chain; violence covereth them as a garment.

paragraphs.content: Their eyes stand out with fatness: they have more than heart could wish.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Their eyes stand out with fatness: they have more than heart could wish.

paragraphs.content: They are corrupt, and speak wickedly concerning oppression: they speak loftily.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They are corrupt, and speak wickedly concerning oppression: they speak loftily.

paragraphs.content: They set their mouth against the heavens, and their tongue walketh through the earth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They set their mouth against the heavens, and their tongue walketh through the earth.

paragraphs.content: Therefore his people return hither: and waters of a full cup are wrung out to them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Therefore his people return hither: and waters of a full cup are wrung out to them.

paragraphs.content: And they say, How doth God know? and is there knowledge in the most High?
paragraphs.contentHtml: And they say, How doth God know? and is there knowledge in the most High?

paragraphs.content: Behold, these are the ungodly, who prosper in the world; they increase in riches.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Behold, these are the ungodly, who prosper in the world; they increase in riches.

paragraphs.content: Verily I have cleansed my heart in vain, and washed my hands in innocency.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Verily I have cleansed my heart in vain, and washed my hands in innocency.

paragraphs.content: For all the day long have I been plagued, and chastened every morning.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For all the day long have I been plagued, and chastened every morning.

paragraphs.content: If I say, I will speak thus; behold, I should offend against the generation of thy children.
paragraphs.contentHtml: If I say, I will speak thus; behold, I should offend against the generation of thy children.

paragraphs.content: When I thought to know this, it was too painful for me;
paragraphs.contentHtml: When I thought to know this, it was too painful for me;

paragraphs.content: Until I went into the sanctuary of God; then understood I their end.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Until I went into the sanctuary of God; then understood I their end.

paragraphs.content: Surely thou didst set them in slippery places: thou castedst them down into destruction.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Surely thou didst set them in slippery places: thou castedst them down into destruction.

paragraphs.content: How are they brought into desolation, as in a moment! they are utterly consumed with terrors.
paragraphs.contentHtml: How are they brought into desolation, as in a moment! they are utterly consumed with terrors.

paragraphs.content: As a dream when one awaketh; so, O Lord, when thou awakest, thou shalt despise their image.
paragraphs.contentHtml: As a dream when one awaketh; so, O Lord, when thou awakest, thou shalt despise their image.

paragraphs.content: Thus my heart was grieved, and I was pricked in my reins.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thus my heart was grieved, and I was pricked in my reins.

paragraphs.content: So foolish was I, and ignorant: I was as a beast before thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: So foolish was I, and ignorant: I was as a beast before thee.

paragraphs.content: Nevertheless I am continually with thee: thou hast holden me by my right hand.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Nevertheless I am continually with thee: thou hast holden me by my right hand.

paragraphs.content: Thou shalt guide me with thy counsel, and afterward receive me to glory.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou shalt guide me with thy counsel, and afterward receive me to glory.

paragraphs.content: Whom have I in heaven but thee? and there is none upon earth that I desire beside thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Whom have I in heaven but thee? and there is none upon earth that I desire beside thee.

paragraphs.content: My flesh and my heart faileth: but God is the strength of my heart, and my portion for ever.
paragraphs.contentHtml: My flesh and my heart faileth: but God is the strength of my heart, and my portion for ever.

paragraphs.content: For, lo, they that are far from thee shall perish: thou hast destroyed all them that go a whoring from thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For, lo, they that are far from thee shall perish: thou hast destroyed all them that go a whoring from thee.

paragraphs.content: But it is good for me to draw near to God: I have put my trust in the Lord GOD, that I may declare all thy works.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But it is good for me to draw near to God: I have put my trust in the Lord God, that I may declare all thy works.
